body: Perhaps {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates expected r_c to be more mournful over m_c's passing, but r_c can't help {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} bitter sense of relief to be free of {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
r_c avoids m_c's vigil. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} content to let {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} Clanmates think it's because {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} grieving privately.
m_c's mate is strikingly absent from the vigil. r_c doesn't want to bother pretending to grieve {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
r_c and m_c had a difficult relationship, but now that m_c is dead, r_c attempts to look back fondly on some of the good times.
r_c studies the body of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate with no emotion coloring {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} gaze. That's that, then.

r_c wonders if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} truly free of m_c, or if the reports of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate's death are exaggerated.
